lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Gah! Damn it all... I'm going after it!

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: The rabbit? It'll be long gone by now, Roland.

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: Here, let's try this again. Try to hit that knot in the tree over there...

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: Remember: One clean motion. No hesitation.

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Alright... let's try this again. H-

lines.speaker: Leah
lines.text: Oh! Simon! Here they are! Though it doesn't look like they've caught much...

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Ah! Leah, you threw off my-

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Your shot? I don't see anything nearby.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: I know the rabbits blend in quite well with the snow, but I'd like to think I've gotten pretty good at spotting them.

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: Well Simon, that would be because he was aiming for the tree!

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Edgar!

lines.speaker: Leah
lines.text: Hmm, I'm not sure that the tree would make a great dinner even if he had hit it,

lines.speaker: Leah
lines.text: though I guess that doesn't make much of a difference in retrospect.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Come on you guys, we can't really be slacking in the winter time!

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Not like we're making any money from the mines for the next couple of months with this weather.

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: Oh, you know I've hunted more than my fair share this season already!

lines.speaker: Leah
lines.text: And yet, you sit here empty handed. Sounds like larger portions for us tonight, wouldn't you say, Simon?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Hmmm, maybe we should take pity? Roland is pretty handy when the mines are running. Edgar though...

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: Wait, wh-

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Hahaha, the tables have turned!

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Oh, speaking of mines, the mail came today, right Simon? Any word about that rock we sent off to the Royal Institute last autumn?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Still none. Though I can't blame them.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: I'm sure 'hayseed up in Taldur Mountains' sending them a rock isn't very high on the priority list, given the war and all.

lines.speaker: Edgar
lines.text: I mean, with how that thing glows, there's no way it could be just a rock.

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: Yeah. That stuff was backbreaking to mine, even though it was just that little piece.

lines.speaker: Roland
lines.text: I'm sure someone who knew what they were doing could make something good out of it.

lines.speaker: Leah
lines.text: I guess we'll just have to wait and see. Now, what say we get back and start cooking dinner before it gets dark? Serena's waiting, I'm sure.
